pr.vendorManualApproval: Vendor will be manually approved for {{months}} months despite issues
pr.vendorNotApproved: Vendor will remain non-approved. Issue will be logged.

pr.notifyProcurementDesc: Send notification to Procurement team for file uploads
pr.confirmAllRequirements: Please confirm all requirements are met:
pr.poDocNotProvided: PO Document not provided (required for high-value PO)
pr.priceVarianceDesc: The final price differs significantly from the approved amount:
pr.exceedsUpwardThreshold: This exceeds the upward threshold of 5% (Rule 6).
pr.exceedsDownwardThreshold: This exceeds the downward threshold of -20% (Rule 7).
pr.priceVarianceJustificationRequired: To proceed with moving this PO to ORDERED status despite the price variance, you must provide a justification. This will be recorded in the audit trail and may require additional review.
pr.priceVariancePlaceholder: Explain why the final price differs significantly from the approved amount (e.g., currency fluctuation, additional requirements, supplier price changes, etc.)
pr.vendorPerformanceRequired: This helps manage vendor approval status automatically
pr.vendorAutoApprovedDesc: Vendor will be automatically approved for future orders
pr.issuesEncountered: NO - Issues encountered during this order
pr.vendorRemainNonApproved: Vendor will remain non-approved unless you override
pr.describeIssuesPlaceholder: Describe quality issues, delivery problems, or other concerns...
pr.overrideJustificationPlaceholder: Explain why vendor should be approved despite the issues...
pr.ruleOverrideDesc: This PR does not meet the standard approval rules. If you need to proceed despite this, you must provide a detailed justification for the override.
pr.ruleOverrideNote: Note: This override will be logged and visible in the PR audit trail. Only authorized users (Admin, Procurement) should approve overrides.
pr.ruleOverridePlaceholder: Explain why this PR should be allowed to proceed despite not meeting the standard approval rules...
pr.unsavedChangesDesc: You have unsaved changes. Are you sure you want to exit edit mode? All changes will be lost.
pr.previousDocumentsDesc: Documents uploaded in previous statuses (read-only - view and download only)
pr.seeStatusHistoryForNotes: See 'Status History & Notes' section below for detailed notes from all approval steps and status changes
pr.quoteRequirementOverrideDesc: The standard quotation requirements were overridden for this PR. The number of quotes submitted does not meet the normal criteria, but an exception was granted.
pr.quoteRequirementOverrideApproverDesc: The PR does not meet standard quote requirements, but you can proceed with justification as an authorized approver (Admin or Senior Approver).
pr.quoteOverridePlaceholder: Explain why this PR should be allowed to proceed despite not meeting the quote requirements...
pr.ruleValidationOverrideDesc: The standard approval rules were overridden for this PR. The selected approver/amount combination does not meet the normal criteria, but an exception was granted.

gettingStarted.title: Getting Started with PR System
gettingStarted.welcome: Welcome to the PR System! This guide will help you get started quickly.
gettingStarted.loginStep1: 1. Navigate to the PR System URL
gettingStarted.loginStep1Desc: Use the link provided by your administrator
gettingStarted.loginStep3Desc: An administrator will assign your permission level
gettingStarted.roleProcurementDesc: Manage quotes, vendors, and order processing
gettingStarted.dashboardMetricsDesc: Total PRs, Urgent PRs, Average Days Open, Overdue PRs
gettingStarted.dashboardMyPRsDesc: Filter to see only PRs relevant to you (sidebar)
gettingStarted.dashboardTableDesc: List of all purchase requests and orders with filters
gettingStarted.dashboardSearchDesc: Find PRs by number, vendor, status, date, and more

requestor.title: Requestor Guide
requestor.description: As a Requestor, you create Purchase Requests when your department needs to buy goods or services.
requestor.step1Desc: Located in top right corner of dashboard
requestor.step2Desc: Organization, Department, Category, Description, Amount, Currency, Required Date
requestor.step3Desc: Click 'Add Line Item' for each product/service needed
requestor.step4Desc: Supporting documents like specs, drawings, or existing quotes
requestor.step5Desc: Double-check all information and click 'Submit PR'
requestor.importantNote: All fields marked with * are required. PRs cannot be edited after submission.
requestor.trackingStep2: 2. PRs you created will be shown
requestor.trackingStep3: 3. Check Status column to see progress
requestor.trackingStep4: 4. Click PR number to view full details
requestor.revisionAlert: When status is REVISION_REQUIRED, action is needed from you!
requestor.revisionStep1: 1. Click on your PR to open it
requestor.dont3: Split purchases to avoid approval thresholds

approver.title: Approver Guide
approver.description: As an Approver, you review PRs to ensure they're necessary, properly justified, and follow company policies.
approver.findingStep1Desc: Shows PRs where you're the assigned approver
approver.findingStep2Desc: Click Status dropdown and select PENDING_APPROVAL
approver.findingStep3Desc: You receive emails when PRs are assigned to you
approver.check1: âœ“ Description is clear and justified
approver.check7: âœ“ Urgency is justified (if marked urgent)
approver.approveSteps:
1. Scroll to "Approver Actions" section
2. Click "Approve" button
3. Add notes (optional but recommended)
4. Click "Confirm Approval"
5. PR moves to next stage
approver.revisionSteps:
1. Click "Request Revision" button
2. Enter detailed notes explaining what needs to change
3. Click "Confirm"
4. PR goes back to requestor
5. Status becomes REVISION_REQUIRED
approver.rejectSteps:
1. Click "Reject" button
2. MUST provide justification
3. Click "Confirm Rejection"
4. PR status becomes REJECTED (terminal)
5. All stakeholders notified
approver.quoteInfo: The system automatically enforces quote rules based on the PR amount
approver.quoteNote: * Thresholds are organization-specific. Contact your administrator for details.

procurement.title: Procurement Guide
procurement.description: As Procurement, you're the hub of the PR process. You manage quotes, vendors, and ensure smooth workflow.
procurement.processStep1Desc: Check all required fields, documents, and clarity
procurement.quoteWarning: Check "Quote Requirements" section to see how many quotes are needed
procurement.quoteStep3: 3. Fill in: Vendor, Amount, Currency, Valid Until, Lead Time
procurement.overrideDesc: If you can't get 3 quotes (vendor monopoly, urgent need, etc.):
procurement.overrideStep1: 1. Add the quotes you have (at least 1)
procurement.overrideNote: Approver will review your justification before deciding
procurement.rfqDesc: Generate professional RFQ PDFs to send to vendors when PR is in IN_QUEUE status.
procurement.rfqTwoWays: Two Ways to Add Line Items:
procurement.rfqManual: â€¢ Manual Entry - Best for small orders (1-5 items)
procurement.rfqBulk: â€¢ Bulk Upload (CSV/Excel) - Best for large orders (dozens/hundreds of items)
procurement.rfqStep1Desc: Click 'Download Template' â†’ Choose Excel (.xlsx) or CSV format
procurement.rfqStep2Desc: Columns: Description, Quantity, UOM, Notes, Est. Price, File/Folder Link (optional)
procurement.rfqStep3Desc: Paste Dropbox/Google Drive/OneDrive 'Copy Link' URLs - System auto-converts them!
procurement.rfqStep4Desc: Click 'Upload Line Items' â†’ Select your filled template
procurement.rfqStep5Desc: Overwrite (replace all) OR Add (append to existing)
procurement.rfqStep6Desc: Click 'Apply' â†’ Then 'Generate RFQ' â†’ Professional PDF downloads
procurement.rfqGoogleDrive: Google Drive: drive.google.com/file/d/ID/view â†’ direct download âœ“
procurement.rfqOneDrive: OneDrive: Adds download parameter automatically âœ“
procurement.rfqAutoNote: Just paste "Copy Link" URLs - no manual conversion needed!
procurement.rfqTrouble1Desc: Ensure files don't require login. Links are preserved as clickable URLs if download fails.
procurement.rfqTrouble2Desc: Use standard UOMs from Reference Data (M, KG, UNIT, L, etc.)
procurement.rfqTrouble3Desc: Don't change column headers. Instruction/example rows are auto-skipped.
procurement.vendorAccess: Access: Admin â†’ Reference Data â†’ Vendors
procurement.vendorStep3: Upload vendor documents (incorporation, tax cert, etc.)
procurement.vendorStep4: View all PRs associated with vendor
procurement.orderStep2: 2. Open PR and review approved quote
procurement.orderStep5: 5. Enter: Selected Vendor, Final Amount, PO Number, Delivery Date

finance.title: Finance/Admin Guide
finance.description: Finance/Admin handles payments and closes completed orders.
finance.closingDesc: When items are delivered and verified:
finance.closingSuccess1: â€¢ Vendor automatically approved for 6-12 months
finance.closingWarning2: â€¢ Optional: Check "Approve vendor despite issues"
finance.closingWarning3: â€¢ Issue logged to vendor record

superadmin.title: Superadmin Guide
superadmin.description: As Superadmin, you have full system access and configuration capabilities.
superadmin.userStep1: Add new users (must use Google account email)

faqs.title: Frequently Asked Questions
faqs.a1: Any user with Requestor level (5) or higher permissions can create a PR.
faqs.q2: Can I edit a PR after submitting?
faqs.a2: No, PRs cannot be edited after submission. If changes are needed, the approver must request revision, which sends the PR back to you for editing. Alternatively, you can cancel and create a new PR.
faqs.a3: Typically 1-3 business days depending on the complexity and amount. Urgent PRs may be processed faster. You'll receive email notifications when status changes.
faqs.q4: When should I mark a PR as urgent?
faqs.a4: Only when there's a genuine urgent need such as equipment breakdown, critical deadline, or safety issue. Don't mark everything urgent as it reduces the priority of truly urgent requests.
faqs.q5: What file types can I upload?
faqs.a5: Images (JPG, PNG, GIF), Documents (PDF, DOC, DOCX), Spreadsheets (XLS, XLSX). Maximum file size is 10MB per file.
faqs.q6: How do I check PR status?
faqs.a6: Enable "My PRs" toggle in the sidebar to see your PRs. Check the Status column, or click on the PR number to see full details including complete status history.
faqs.a7: Verify you're using your organization Google account. Contact your administrator to ensure your account exists in the system and is activated. Try clearing browser cache or using incognito mode.
faqs.q8: Where can I get more help?
faqs.a8: Contact your IT support team or system administrator. Have your name, email, PR number (if applicable), and description of the issue ready.

footer.needHelp: Need more help? Contact your system administrator
